iiv.data

Class CNUTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • iiv.data.CNUTypes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CNUTypesConstants

    public class CNUTypes
extends Object
implements CNUTypesConstants
    A utility class for working with different data types.

        Returns:

      • UnsignedByteToInt

        public static final int UnsignedByteToInt(byte b)
        Converts an unsigned byte value to an integer. Bote - java only supports signed byte so casting produces the wrong results for values greater then 127. Unsigned values from 128 to 255 are seen as -128 to -1 when stored as signed byte.
        Parameters:
        b - unsigned byte to convert
        Returns:
        integer value

      • UnsignedShortToInt

        public static final int UnsignedShortToInt(short b)
        Converts an unsigned short value to integer. Note - java only supports signed short so casting would produce the wrong results for values greater then 32767. Unsigned values from 32768 to 65535 are seen as -32768 to -1 when stored as signed short.

      • copyArray

        public static final void copyArray(Object inarray,
                                   int inoffset,
                                   int intype,
                                   int inInc,
                                   Object outarray,
                                   int outoffset,
                                   int outtype,
                                   int cnt,
                                   CNUScale sc)
        Copies an array of one data type into an array of possibly another input type. Data from the input array can be undersampled or reverse sampled by specifying an in increment other then one.
        Parameters:
        inarray - input data array
        inoffset - location of input array to begin copying from
        intype - CNU data type of input array
        inInc - amount to increment to get to the next input word after copying each word
        outarray - output data array
        outoffset - location of output array to begin copying to
        outtype - CNU data type of output array
        cnt - number of words to copy from input to output
        sc - CNUScale class describing linear translation and scaling to apply to words copied.

      • copyRegion

        public static final int copyRegion(Object inArray,
                                   int inOffset,
                                   int inType,
                                   int[] inInc,
                                   Object outArray,
                                   int outOffset,
                                   int outType,
                                   int[] outDims,
                                   int currentDim,
                                   CNUScale sc)
        Copies a multi-dimensional square region from one data array to completely fill another. The amount of data copied is governed by the array of output dimensions. The output array is filled from the output offset with no word skipping. Uses a recursive routine - calling this routine to copy bytes for lower dimensions until lowest dimension (currentDim = 0) is reached and then calling copyArray.
        Parameters:
        inArray - input data array
        inOffset - location of input array to begin copying from
        inType - CNU data type of input array
        inInc - array containing one increment for each dimension. The increments specify the number of words to the next input word for the same dimension.
        outArray - output data array
        outOffset - location of output array to begin copying to
        outType - CNU data type of output array
        outDims - array of output dimensions which governs the amount of data copied for each dimension
        currentDim - index of dimension recursive routine is currently working with
        sc - CNUScale class describing linear translation and scaling to apply to words copied.
        Returns:
        the offset to the next location in the output array.

      • arrayToScript

        public static final String arrayToScript(Object obj)
        Converts an array of primitive type to a bsh script to recreate the array.
        Parameters:
        object - array of primitive type
        Returns:
        string representing the array

      • arrayToString

        public static final String arrayToString(Object obj,
                                         int begin,
                                         int end)
        Converts an array of primitive type to a bracked delimited, comma seperated string.
        Parameters:
        object - array of primitive type
        begin - start location for printing values from the array
        end - end location for printing values from the array. If less then 0 prints to end of array.
        Returns:
        string representing the array
